text: Viktor Robertovich Tsoi (; 21 June 1962 â€“ 15 August 1990) was a Soviet singer and songwriter. He co-founded Kino, one of the most popular bands in the Soviet Union at its time. == Life == Tsoi was born and raised in Leningrad. He started writing songs when he was a teenager.Viktor Tsoi's biography at the website lichnosti.net He made lots of music - ten albums in total. After Kino was in the 1987 Soviet film Assa, it became very popular. This lead to Tsoi having a leading role in the Kazakh new wave art film The Needle. In 1990, after their large concert at the Luzhniki Stadium. Tsoi moved to Latvia with another member of Kino, Yuri Kasparyan to work on Kino's next album. Two months after the concert in the Luzhniki Stadium, Tsoi died in a car crash. Tsoi and his music are still widely popular. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Viktor Tsoi's 50th Birthday Google Doodle Category:1962 births Category:1990 deaths Category:Musicians by genre Category:Rock musicians Category:Soviet musicians Category:Korean musicians Category:Russian musicians
title: Viktor Tsoi
